text: A wide shot in which you could be forgiven for failing to spot a tiny, brightly-clothed FIGURE on one of the roofto Over this, we hear the voice of our hero: DAVE LIZEWSKI.

I always wondered why nobody did it before me. I mean, all those comic books. Movies. TV shows... You’d think that one eccentric loner would have made himself a costume. We track in towards the figure: a YOUNG MAN IN A SUPERHER COSTUME. Perilously near the edge, striking an iconic pos With cool resolve, he slips a pair of GOGGLES into positi
Is everyday life really so exciting, are schools and offices so thrilling, that I’m the only one who ever fantasized about this? He spreads his arms to reveal awesome MECHANICAL WINGS.
C’mon. Be honest with yourself. Calmly, he dives off the roof.

At some point in our lives, we all wanted to be a superhero. A smile on his face. A beautiful open vista of concrete a glass windows reflecting the low sun. He’s in flight. Oh wait... No he’s not. The smile fades. This isn’t flyin Just good old-fashioned falling.

Fuuuuuck! Below, pedestrians become aware of his impending approach Pointing and screaming. Camera phones. Running to safety. He lands on a PARKED CAR. It crumples like paper. The CAR ALARM strikes up over the crowd noise. We needn’t look cl to be sure that he’s dead. But what the hell. We track in
That’s not me, by the way. That’s some Armenian guy with a history of mental health problems. On the news, his sister said he read about me in the New York Post.
A huge, antiquated building. STUDENTS mill around outside CAR pulls up and out climbs highschool senior DAVID LIZEW Not quite Napoleon Dynamite, but not quite Zac Efron eith
That's me. Back before any of this stuff happened. Back when you’d have to be a lot crazier than that guy to try and be like me. He waves to his father, MR LIZEWSKI, who is driving...
Later, Dad. ...And sets off towards the school entrance.
Not saying there was anything wrong with me. Just that you’d have had a hard time finding a hook. (a beat) I mean, I wasn’t into sport... HE strolls past a brace of SOCCER-TEAM GIRLS kicking a ba
Dave joins the back of a line of kids, all waiting to pas one by one through a METAL DETECTOR ARCHWAY.
I wasn’t a mathlete... We move down the line to see three NICE KIDS ahead of him
or a hard-core gamer... Two BOYS. Their t-shirts say “AFK”, and “The cake is a li
I didn’t have a piercing, or an eating disorder, or three thousand friends on MySpace. Four skinny, pierced EMOS stand at the front of the line.
I wasn’t funny. A chubby white guy, who we’ll come to know as MARTY, danc through the archway doing the “Soulja Boy” dance.
The bell RINGS. Dave and the class scramble into their se

Like most people my age, I just existed. Dave's teacher MRS ZANE, 40, comes in. A slightly chubby borderline milf. She takes off her jacket and hangs it up INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 5 Dave lies on his bed watching TV.

Kick in my bedroom door and you'd probably find me watching TV. Or talking to my friend Todd on Skype. Dave sits at his PC. On the screen: a You Tube page and, minimized window, the face of Dave’s best friend TODD.
You watching Family Guy?
No.
Me neither. The sound dips and we return to Dave's V.O.
Or jerking off. Mostly to my biology teacher.

In a replay of what we just saw, Mrs Zane takes off her jacket. Then she stares right at us and takes off her blo She reaches back to unhook her bra just as we cut to: INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 7 From our vantage point under Dave’s desk, we can see his PANTS around his ankles. A wad of SOILED TISSUES are drop into the WASTEPAPER BASKET by his feet.
Though, to be honest, it didn’t take much to set me off.  10

Dave’s COMPUTER SCREEN. A homework document headed “The Maasai tribe”, and a shot of some bare-breasted tribeswom He types: “...traditional ceremonial bead-work”. Then - sentence abandoned - the cursor clicks to minimise the document and bring the tribeswomen to the foreground. Another handful of tissues goes in the basket. Dave's playing WORLD OF WARCRAFT. His female NIGHT ELF is screen. The cursor fliesto and fro, removing all her clot Fingers moving urgently on the keyboard, Dave types “/dan The nearly-naked digital elf performs a sexy dance. Another tissue drops into the basket. A copy of TV GUIDE is tossed to the floor. Followed by another tissue.
I tell you, when my hormones balance out, shares in Kleenex are gonna take a dive, man.
Where we left off, Mrs Zane takes her seat and leans forw to put down her purse. She catches Dave looking at her ti
Dave Lizewski. You might want to be looking at your textbook about now?
Yes, Mrs. Zane. Sorry. She flashes a playful mock-stern frown, then an amused sm before looking away. Truth is, she’s flattered.
Sure, a lot of what got me through the average school day was making deposits in the wack-off warehouse for later. But don’t get me wrong. I liked girls my own age, too.
Dave walks the crowded corridor, eyes fixed on a striking cute girl who is fumbling in her locker: KATIE DEAUXMA.
Especially Katie Deauxma.  11 Katie looks up and breaks into a broad smile.
Hey gorgeous!
Hey! Katie claps her hand over her mouth, and, hearing a bark laughter from behind him, Dave wheels round to see the pe Katie was actually addressing: her best friend ERIKA CHO.
Oh my god.
No, you meant - Erika. I know. I knew that. You were... I was just kidding. I knew you didn’t...
Oh god. ...mean me.
That was...
It’s cool. Ok then. See ya... later He hurries away. Behind him, Erika and Katie clutch each other in helpless laughter as Katie dies of embarrassment
I was just a regular guy. INT. DAVE’S KITCHEN. DAY. 11 Dave sits at the table with his DAD, AND HIS MOM, 42. She eating cereal.
No radioactive spiders. No refugee status from a doomed alien world. Dave morosely pours himself a bowl of CORN PUFFS.

Know what? Todd said they do still make Count Chocula. They just don’t sell it at the A&P any more. Suddenly, Dave’s mom slumps forward onto the table. Her bowl of cereal crashes to the floor, the spilled corn puffs bouncing iconically towards us like the pearls from Martha Wayne’s broken necklace.  12 13
My mother was killed by an aneurism in the kitchen, as opposed to a gunman in an alley. So if you were hoping for any... Close on the cereal box as it morphs into...
...A GRAVESTONE. Behind it, the New York skyline just vis through a fierce storm. Dave: dripping wet, fists aloft, raging at the heavens through the thunder and lightning.
I will avenge you, mother!
+-.-You’re outta luck. The tombstone morphs back into... INT. DAVE’S KITCHEN. DAY. 13 -+-A box of COUNT CHOCULA cereal. Just Dave and his dad a the breakfast table now.
In fact, in the eighteen months since my mother died, the only epiphany I had was realizing that, like it or not, life just goes on. Dave studies the cereal box.
They never had so many mallow pieces when I was a kid.
Oh.
Hey, I have something for you. He hands Dave three MOVIE TICKETS. Dave lights up.
Spiderman 8! Thursday?! The sneak preview?! Dad, you officially rock! Don’t you got a shift Thursday night?
They’re for you and the guys.  14
A fanboy’s dream. Two storeys of comic books, toys and collectibles, with a coffee-shop concession. Dave is here with Todd and Marty, chatting and drinking frappucinos.
How come nobody’s ever tried to be a superhero?
Gee, I dunno. Oh wait, yeah I do. Cos it’s fucking impossible, dickwad.
What, putting on a mask and helping people? How is that impossible?
That’s not a superhero, though. How is that super? Super is like, being stronger than everybody and flying and shit. That’s just hero.
It’s not even hero, it’s fuckin’ psycho.
Hello? What about Bruce Wayne? He didn’t have any powers.
Yeah, but he had all expensive shit that doesn’t exist. I thought you meant, like how come no one does it in real life.
Yeah, I guess I did mean that.
C’mon. Anyone who did it for real would just get their ass kicked. They'd be dead in like, a day.
I’m not saying they should do it. I just can’t figure out why no one does. Seriously, out of all the millions of people who love superheroes, you’d think at least one would give it a try. (MORE )
All those mid-life crisis guys in the guitar store, they’re never gonna be rockstars, but it doesn’t stop ‘em buying guitars.
M (shrugging) Yeah, I guess. leh.
Jesus, doesn’t it bug you? Why do thousands of people wanna be Paris Hilton, and nobody wants to be Spiderman?
Yeah, what’s with that? She has, like, no tits. None at all.
Maybe it’s the porn tape. He doesn’t have a porn tape.
You never saw One Night in Spiderman? They all crack up. But suddenly, Todd is distracted.
Holy shit, check out the wheels. He nods over to the storefront window. A huge black stret S-class MERCEDES has pulled up outside.
Looks like Mr. D’Amico traded in the hummer.

Nah. He probably kept it. And has, like, both? A teenage boy climbs out - CHRIS D’AMICO, 17 and self- conscious. He shuffles in followed by a large BODY GUARD. Chris begins to browse a rack of comics, sneaking a look at Dave and his friends before looking hurriedly away.
Is it just me, or do you feel kinda sorry for Chris D’Amico?
Yeah. Woah. Must suck to have a rich dad and everything you want. (MORE )
In fact, I wish you hadn’t brought it up. I think I’m gonna cry.
Yeh, but he’s always on his own.
We should, like, talk to him. See if he wants to hang with us.
I wasn’t saying we should talk to him, just, like -
It'd be awesome! Think about it: if he was our friend, no one would ever fuck with us again! Dave and Marty consider this. Marty nods over towards Chr
Go on then, Todd.
Nuh-uh. Dave should go.

Why? I just said I felt sorry - Aw shit, ok, fine. Dave makes his way over to the register, where Chris is n in line. Nearby, the Bodyguard pretends to read a comic. Chris sees Dave approaching and smiles. Dave smiles back an awkward wave. The bodyguard glances up from the comic.
Fuck off. This guy is massive. Dave does not need to be asked twice From Chris’ pov, we watch Dave return to his friends and enact the encounter. All three burst into laughter.
Dave and Todd walk home, carrying their BAGS of new comic Then, from nowhere, TWO GANG KIDS block their path. The bigger kid holds out his hand matter-of-factly.
Phones. Money.
Aw man, not again.  16 10. Dave hands over his phone and cash. Todd just gives cash.
Phone.
I don’t have one! Somebody else jacked it last week!
Gimme the bag.
It’s just comics.
You wanna get cut? Todd reluctantly hands over the bag of comics, and the ki walk away casually. Shaken and angry, Todd and Dave walk

TRE FERNANDEZ, 30, unlikely to join his local neighbourho watch scheme any time soon, is tied to a chair, his finge in a pair of heavy-duty BOLT-CUTTERS held by a HUGE GOON. Several other goons surround him - let’s call them GINGER SCARY, SPORTY, BABY and POSH. And here’s FRANK D’AMICO, 5 and his right-hand man, BIG JOE. You know by the cut of Frank's suit that he’s in charge.
Frankie... Frank, I’m telling you, man. I swear I’m not making this up. This fucking guy... Comes outta nowhere -
This would be the guy who looks like Batman.
I didn’t say he looked like Batman.
You did, you said the guy looked like Batman.
He said, like, a black mask and stuff.
And a cape.  17 18 11.
Like Batman.
I didn’t say ‘like Batman.’ I never said ‘Batman’.
So this guy, he comes in, outta nowhere. TRE. Right. Outta nowhere. Fucks us up real bad.
And this is who killed Johnnie...
Right. And my two guys.
..-And jacked my coke.
He didn’t exactly jack it.

A hyper-stylized fantasy sequence. Tre lies on the floor with a gusher of a nosebleed, clutching a BAG OF COKE. TW DEAD CRONIES lie nearby. The last man standing is JOHNNIE - clearly the muscle. Tr watches in dismay as the even-bigger SUPERHERO steps behi Johnnie and slices his throat with a HUNTING KNIFE. The Superhero turns on Tre, who throws the bag of cocaine into his face, bolts for the open window and jumps out. T masked man, his black costume now covered in coke, watche out of the window as Tre limps away for his life.
Frank fixes Tre with an impassive look.
And this guy... This guy who killed everyone else, he doesn’t bother to follow you. Because?
Because, I don’t know. I swear Frank, I’m just telling you what happened.  19 20 12.
Okay. Let me explain the problem I got here, Tre. Our mole with the Russians tells it a bit different.

Another stylized fantasy sequence. A TALL RUSSIAN shows T BRIEFCASE full of CASH. A group of RUSSIAN HOODS look on. nods his approval and the tall Russian clicks the case sh and hands it over, in exchange for a large bag of coke.
Tre reacts to what he’s just heard.
You're kidding me?
(re: the bolt cutters) Does it look to you like I’m kidding?
Our guy said you gave them Russians a pretty sweet deal.
It’s a fucking lie, man! I can’t believe you believe this shit from a fucking Russian, man.
Let’s see, Tre. What’s more likely? You're a greedy little cocksucker, or my coke is missing because it wound up all over Superman’s face.
Batman.
What?
Batman’s face.
I never said Batman!

Oh for fuck’s sake. My son’s in the car, waiting to go to the movies. Joe, you're in charge.  21 22 13. He snaps his fingers as he turns to go. Joe nods. The hug goon snips the bolt-cutters closed. Tre screams.
We can still hear the distant screams as Frank - shadowed Ginger Goon - climbs into the back of the waiting Merc.
Frank gets in beside his son - Chris, who we met earlier and the bodyguard. Ginger Goon sits in the front.
Sorry you had to wait, buddy.
I coulda waited inside. I’m sick of being treated like a kid.
We're not having this conversation again, Chris. (to the bodyguard) Where’s the driver?
Restroom.
The movie’s starting in, like, 10 minutes. We can still hear screaming coming from inside the wareho studiously ignored by everyone in the car.
We're cool. It’s okay. We’re only gonna miss the trailers.
Yeah, but I wanted to, you know, get popcorn.
(to the bodyguard) When we get there, get Chris some popcorn, okay? And bring it in. What do you wanna drink, Pepsi? Chris nods grudgingly. The screaming continues, escalates
You got it, sir.  23 24 25 14.
And I’1l have an Icee. Mixed. Like, when they mix the red one and the blue one? The driver gets in. From inside the warehouse, we hear tw gunshots. Everyone but Frank flinches. Nobody mentions it
And a pack of Twizzlers. Drive.
The limo pulls up outside the theatre. A few people line for tickets as a huge tide of others flood out. Among the an elated Dave, Todd and Marty - talking excitedly about movie they’ve just seen.

The comic-books had it wrong. It didn’t take a trauma, or cosmic rays or a power ring to make a superhero. INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 24 Dave undresses. In his underpants, he really looks like j a little kid. The camera jibs down to see a UPS PACKAGE. From it, Dave pulls out: a WET-SUIT and a SKI MASK. He pulls them on and looks in the MIRROR.
You are fucking awesome. He strikes a superhero pose, throws a few martial arts mo
...dust the perfect combination of optimism and naivety.
Meet MINDY MACREADY. 11 years old, and tiny. Wearing a wo hat, a padded jacket and an intense frown.
Daddy? I’m scared. Her father, DAMON, 35, is big and ripped and has a killer handle-bar moustache. But he’s softly spoken.  15.
C’mon Mindy, honey. Be a big girl now. Nothin’ to be afraid of. We pull back to take in Damon’s full towering height. In hand is A GUN. He loads the magazine.
Is it gonna hurt bad?

Only for a second, sugar. (off her pout) Handgun bullet goes more than 700 miles an hour, so at close range like this, the force is gonna take you right off your feet, for sure. But it’s really no more painful than a punch in the chest. Okay?
No. I hate getting punched in the chest.

You'll be fine, baby doll. Before she can protest, he releases the slide, takes the safety off, aims the gun at her and fires off a round. The bullet hits her square in the chest. She flies throug the air, landing on her back a couple of feet away.
Not so bad, huh? She sits up stiffly and shrugs at him. Then she unzips he jacket to study the KEVLAR VEST underneath. She pokes her finger into the little dent left by the bullet.
Now you know how it feels, you won't be scared when some junkie asshole pulls a glock.
Wouldn’a been scared anyways. Damon guffaws, pulls off her hat and ruffles her hair.
That's my girl! ‘kay. Up you get. Couple more rounds, then home.
Uh-huh.
Only if we can go Ben and Jerry's on the way back.
Hmm. Okay. Two rounds, no wincing, no whining and you got yourself a deal, young lady. She gets up and faces him, arms outstretched, grinning.
I’m gonna get Phish Food and Chunky Monkey!

Good call, baby! He takes aim and - BAM! - cracks off another round. INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. DAY. 26 Dave, wearing his costume, slips jeans and a long-sleeved over the top. He grabs his school bag and leaves.

Mrs Zane is at the whiteboard but Dave isn’t watching. He writes in his book, fingering the collar of his costume u his shirt, a sly smile playing on his lips. In Dave’s notebook are several heroic DOODLES of himself costume, and some names: Night Walker, Bad Night, Bad Ass He writes down: Kick Ass. Then a bunch of question marks. INT. BEN AND JERRY’S. DAY. 28 Mindy is here with Damon, scoffing a large core sundae. F sauce drips onto her padded jacket. She looks down to wip off and notices five bullet holes.
Daddy! Lookit!
I know, honey. Good job! Hey, you had any more thoughts on what you want for your birthday?  29 30 31 17.
Mmmm. Can I get a puppy?
(surprised) A... puppy? Like, a dog?
Yeah. A cuddly fluffy one. Anda Bratz Moviestar Makeover Sasha. Damon looks like he’s about to have a seizure. Mindy spit ice-cream everywhere as she bursts into giggles.

Just fucking with you daddy! I'd love a Benchmade model-42 butterfly knife. Damon joins in the laughter, relieved. EXT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK. DAY. 29 A black Lexus pulls up and a LIVERIED DOORMAN steps forwa to open the door. BIG JOE climbs out, nods his greeting t the doorman, and enters the building. INT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK - LOBBY. CONTINUOUS. 30 Inside, Big Joe greets a SECOND DOORMAN and walks towards bank of elevators. One is guarded by Scary Goon. Inside t elevator, Posh Goon ushers big Joe in and closes the door INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - KITCHEN. 31 A beautiful bespoke kitchen/breakfast room. Outside, an incredible view of Manhattan. Clearly, business is boomin Frank and Chris eat breakfast with Chris’s mother, ANGIE D’‘AMICO, 47 and looking good. Posh Goon pops his head round the door.
Big Joe to see you, sir.
Okay, okay. (to Angie) Sorry hon. She rolls her eyes good-naturedly as she stands up, takin her bowl of oatmeal with her, and heads out of the room.  18.
No problem. Chris?
(to Frank) I don’t mind you talking business. I'll just sit quiet. I should, like, start learning and stuff. Frank points at the door. Chris gets up and stomps out.
I’m gonna be 18 in eight months for chrissakes. Frank ignores him and greets Joe, who gives Chris an affectionate slap on the back as he passes. Joe sits down
We got ourselves a problem, Frank.
And here was me, thinking you broke up my family breakfast cuz you wanted to discuss last night’s Dancing with the Stars.
Our Russian says Tre just gave them another 5 K’s, half price.
Which Tre? Tre Tre? Tre Fernandez?
Right. Tre Tre. Dead Tre.
So now I’m getting fucked in the ass by a ghost.
Or Tre was telling the truth.
This is my choice? I have to believe in ghosts or superheroes?
Not the part about the superhero. Just that he mighta really been gaffled by somebody.
I think it’s time we invited our Russian friend over for a friendly chat. See what’s really going on.  32 33 34 35 19.
Put his balls in a vice?
Right.
Cool. I just wanted to double check. Cos there was that one time you said “friendly chat”, and you meant it literally, and I thought -
I remember.
So, better safe than sorry, y'know?
Dave, in his costume, carefully treads the edge of the ro
I'll be honest, there wasn’t a whole lotta crime fighting in those first few weeks. He reaches the corner and looks across to the next roofto He glances down into the narrow alleyway separating the t
The alley we looked down into before. Dave checks he’s no being watched, then runs a TAPE MEASURE between the walls
But even so, my new vocation kept me plenty busy. I didn’t even have time for internet porn any more.
Dave has placed two pieces of wood that distance apart. H runs up to the first, leaps... lands nowhere near the sec
Dave pumps iron.
If my friends wondered what the fuck was going on with me, they never mentioned it.  36 37 38 39 20.

Dave sits with Todd and Marty eating a plate of FISH, STE and BOILED EGGS. The guys don’t bat an eyelid. Marty poke eye holes in a piece of bread and wears it as a BANDIT MA INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 37 Dave poses in his costume, flexing his still-tiny pecs.
All I knew was I’d never felt so good about myself.

Dave, back at his long-jump, makes several more unsuccess attempts before he finally lands clear of his target. Close on his feet as we see his subsequent landings past second piece of timber, getting further and further away.
I called it preparation. Finally, he takes a run up and we see that the pieces of timber have been put aside, and he is now going for the r thing. He reaches the edge of the roof... and stops.

But if you called it fantasizing, it woulda been hard to argue. INT. MINDY AND DAMON’S APARTMENT. DAY. 39 The kind of place you’d expect to see in a documentary ab scary-ass opt-out survivalists - boarded-up windows, a gu rack, not much furniture. Damon sits on one of several ME TRUNKS, grinning as Mindy admires a PAINTING. Now we see that it is a brilliantly rendered piece of com book artwork depicting them in costume, dynamically posed
You like?
I love! You’re the bestest comic artist, Daddy!
He beams and hands her a prettily wrapped PARCEL.  21.
And here’s your proper present. Happy birthday, baby. Mindy tears it open and squeals: It’s the exact BUTTERFLY KNIFE she asked for. She flings her arms around Damon’s n
Thank you, thank you, thank you! She studies the knife and tentatively begins to attempt a traditional “flipping” moves. She succeeds surprisingly w
Daddy, look! Damon applauds encouragingly until the blade accidentally slices the back of her hand. She stops and studies the cu
shit. She wipes her hand on her jeans and starts flipping again
Okay, pop quiz. What’s the proper name for one of those?
Easy: “Balisong”. It’s Filipino. Ask me another.
Mmmm. ‘kay... The AR15 was a lighter, smaller calibre version of what design? She nicks her hand again. Wipes it, unperturbed. Continue
Eugene Stoner’s AR10. Now gimme a hard one.
When did Samuel Colt get his US patent?
I said a hard one! February 25th, 1836.
John Woo’s first full-length feature. Mindy’s knife flipping is getting ridiculously good now. times, the knife is just a silver streak in her little ha  40 4l 42 22.
Tie Han Rou Qing. The Young Dragons... Look, daddy, look! You're not looking!

At a junction, Dave wheels his bike beside Todd and Marty all carrying BAGS from the comic store. This is where the part company. Dave mounts up, waves goodbye and rides off He rides on, down the same shitty street we saw earlier. Nearby, two boys skulk by a car. The guys who mugged Dave Todd. One has a SCREWDRIVER. He looks up, stares at Dave.

Like every serial killer already knew, eventually fantasizing just doesn’t do it for you anymore. It was time to engage. Dave looks away, keeps pedalling, head down. But his spee gradually slows until, at the next alleyway, he stops dea
Dave chains his bike to a fire-escape. He tears open his shirt, revealing his costume underneath. This is it.

The first gang kid has his screwdriver wedged under the window rubber and is prying it off. His friend loiters nearby, smoking a JOINT and keeping lookout. They pause, utterly bewildered, at the sight of: Dave. Walking towards them in his full, costumed splendor.
What... the... fuck?!
The fuck are you looking at? Dave hesitates. They start to walk towards him.
I said what are you looking at?
Two cheapshit losers screwing with a car that somebody probably worked their ass off to pay for.  43 44 23.
Say what?
Leave it man. Motherfucker be high.

I’m not high. I just think it sucks that you figure you can do whatever you want. Walk away from the car, and we can just forget about it. Without warning, the first kid steps up and punches Dave. Dave reels. But now we see that, behind his back, he has piece of LEAD PIPE. He cracks it over the kid’s head. The goes down, the screwdriver flying from his hand. A beat. Then the second kid sets on Dave. The pipe gives an initial advantage. But now the first guy is up again.

Fuck this shit! You crazy, man! He pulls A KNIFE and, before Dave even realizes it, he’s stabbed in the gut. He looks down in disbelief. Then drop The gang kids run. Dave gets up and staggers to the road.

Dave stumbles into the road as A CAR approaches. He tries flag it, but the ALARMED FEMALE DRIVER accelerates past h Dave turns in disbelief to watch the car disappear into t distance... failing to see A SECOND CAR speed towards him ploughs into him, sending him flying like a rag-doll. The car slows and a terrified BUSINESSMAN stares out to s Dave is out cold, his legs and pelvis grotesquely twisted his costume covered in blood. The driver is in serious sh He looks around. No witnesses. Panicking, he speeds away.
We fade up to Dave’s POV. A SIREN is wailing. A MEDIC is cutting off his costume. The medic shouts up to the drive
Back and responsive! (to Dave) Easy, pal. Take it easy. Don’t try to move.  45 46 24. Dave is in a neck brace, an oxygen mask over his face.
My dad is gonna kill me.
He’s gonna be happy you’re alive.
I need a favour. Please? Don’t tell anybody about the costume?
You got it. The medic deposits the shredded costume in the MEDICAL WA RECEPTACLE. Dave smiles with relief. Then his eyes roll b
(shouting to the driver) Losing him again!
We fade up to Dave’s POV: a blur of bright lights and concerned faces, as the hospital gurney speeds him along.
I don’t remember a whole lot from the first days at the hospital. Just that the pain was a thousand times worse than anything I'd ever experienced. A nurse leans down with a needle.
And the morphine was a thousand times better. Dave lies in a hospital bed, bandaged and wired up, aslee Beside him sits his drained father, staring into space.
A rather battered Russian, DANIL, 30, sits on a chair, ha tied behind his back. Nearby, Big Joe talks on his cell.
They don’t have the vice here no more... No. They only treat the lumber here now... Yeah, but the thing they use for that is even better... Exactly... Okay, cool. (MORE )
(to Huge Goon) Go ahead. The Huge Goon pulls Danil up and, followed by Joe, begins walk him across the warehouse, past piles of WOOD.

Look, the guy tells me he is Tre Fernandez, what do I know? Now you say Fernandez is dead, so, okay, this guy, he lie about who he is. They arrive at a large INDUSTRIAL MICROWAVE OVEN, its doo open. The Huge goon punches Danil in the face and pushes inside. He bolts the door and studies the OPERATION PANEL
Does it have settings? Like on a regular microwave?

The fuck do I know? We’re not making a fucking Hungry Man dinner, just turn it on! Exasperated, Joe leans past the goon and hits the LARGEST BUTTON. A very loud WHIRR starts up. BIG JOE (CONT’D) (shouting to Danil) Who did you buy our coke from? And this time, don’t tell us somebody who's dead. Danil peers out, desperate, his hand cupped to his ear.
Can he hear you? I don’t think he can hear you.
Now Danil is in pain. We can faintly hear him shrieking. Big Joe begins to mime his question, one word at a time: open handed shrug... a “handing over” gesture... a point.
But before he can finish, there’s a popping sound, and - SPLAT - the viewing window is decorated with Danil’s insi
shit.  26.
Dave lies in bed, awakening slowly from his sleep. In the chair where we last saw Dave's father, is his mother.
Mom? What are you doing here?
David honey, you need to get better now. Your poor dad... First me then you? You really can’t go dying. Dave squeezes his eyes shut.
This isn’t real.
It’s not?

Nah. I don’t believe in ghosts. He opens his eyes. She’s gone, and in her place is a CHIN FAMILY in traditional rural dress - a MAN, a PREGNANT WOM and FIVE SMALL CHILDREN. The woman turns to her husband a whispers in Mandarin, subtitled.
He believes in reincarnation.
